blog.name: theamericankorra
blog.title: KORRA SATO
blog.description: Welcome to my lair, Female/she/her/ace/ISTJ/Virgo/Team Valor/Chicago based: sometimes this blog is Korra, sometimes it's Avatar, Star Wars, Dragonball, Voltron...it's a mess, but if you like art, fandom culture,Vegeta, funny pics, cute animals, Broly, traveling and loads of Korrasami, this is the blog for you. Next con: KamehaCon, Dallas Fan Expo, AX2019

title: The Future of Pokemon Go
body:
When this game first released, the system was pretty capitalist based. There was a wide gap between those with money and those without. Many players quit the game out of such frustration knowing that they may never complete the pokedex. Because of all the inequalities and outright showing off and bragging on Mystic7′s part, spoofing ran rampant and legit players like myself were not happy. The game has changed a lot since then and those gaps are slowly closing in between the elite Mystic7′s of the game and the common people. So to that question on completing the dex. If you are playing the game at this time, you WILL complete the pokedex no matter where you live. EX raids are really not a special privilege to elites after all, it’s just a cooler sounding term for a beta test. I beta test for deviantart myself and some of the features I’ve tested features that have taken at most two years to roll out to the public. If you caught a mewtwo through an EX raid, you were a part of a beta test, that’s what it was pure and simple. It doesn’t make you cooler or better, it just means you were selected to test a feature that would go public at some point. Mewtwo is no longer a beta test pokemon, it has gone public like any beta feature will eventually. The next EX pokemon will be Deoxys so here’s the question, do you want to grind for a year in order to get a rare chance at being in a beta test or do you want to wait for the feature to be made public? Is it really that worth it? Also, gen 1 region exclusives are going public worldwide through eggs so saving up money to travel is now no longer the only option. 

What is the future of the game? 

1. Spoofing will become irrelevant. While there will always be spoofers, the reasons for spoofing are now meaningless. There are events that allow players to fill in their pokedex by region so if you play this game, you will catch everything eventually. Spoofers will have no defense for their cheating and the number of them will decrease dramatically. 


2. Youtuber channels will lose bragging rights. Since everyone will catch everything at some point, the big name you tubers really do not gain anything by showing off their catches. Having a mewtwo won’t make you a super elite anymore, it just makes you a guy with a mewtwo. You tubers will probably shift their focus from showing off their pokemon to tutorials and in game tips and tricks. 


3. Traveling to catch regionals will be meaningless and a waste of good money. Since regionals are now hatchable, you won’t have to spend big money to get them. Traveling will be an added bonus but not necessary. 


4. More players will join the game. Since the in game capitalism is now obsolete, more players will be attracted to the game now that everyone has an equal chance to catch everything. 


5. Big city privilege is a thing of the past. With research quests, in game events and raid rotations, players from all over don’t have to live in a sea of pidgeys. The game is now fair to everyone so location does not mean anything.

summary: If Lilligant ever got an evolution and a secondary typing, what would make the most sense? Ideally, I’d hope for Water or Fire,...
body: If Lilligant ever got an evolution and a secondary typing, what would make the most sense? Ideally, I’d hope for Water or Fire, but with Water it would conflict heavily with Ludicolo, who I desperately want to get Quiver Dance. And if it got Fire, it would conflict with my ideal evolution for Sunflora and Bellossom. I’m sure there could be others, but for some reason I’m most drawn to those two.

reblog.comment: If Lilligant ever got an evolution and a secondary typing, what would make the most sense? Ideally, I’d hope for Water or Fire, but with Water it would conflict heavily with Ludicolo, who I desperately want to get Quiver Dance. And if it got Fire, it would conflict with my ideal evolution for Sunflora and Bellossom. I’m sure there could be others, but for some reason I’m most drawn to those two.

trail.content_raw: If Lilligant ever got an evolution and a secondary typing, what would make the most sense? Ideally, I’d hope for Water or Fire, but with Water it would conflict heavily with Ludicolo, who I desperately want to get Quiver Dance. And if it got Fire, it would conflict with my ideal evolution for Sunflora and Bellossom. I’m sure there could be others, but for some reason I’m most drawn to those two.
trail.content: If Lilligant ever got an evolution and a secondary typing, what would make the most sense? Ideally, I’d hope for Water or Fire, but with Water it would conflict heavily with Ludicolo, who I desperately want to get Quiver Dance. And if it got Fire, it would conflict with my ideal evolution for Sunflora and Bellossom. I’m sure there could be others, but for some reason I’m most drawn to those two.

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Darcario Darkrai and Lucario fusion Dark/Fighting Type Ability: Nightmare Knockout - Darcario has a 35% chance to put the...
caption:
Darcario

Darkrai and Lucario fusion

Dark/Fighting Type

Ability: Nightmare Knockout - Darcario has a 35% chance to put the opposing pokemon to sleep with contact moves

Stats: HP - 80, Atk - 140, Def - 80, SpA - 140, SpD - 80, Spe - 130

The Corrupted Jackal Pokemon

Darcario has deep regrets about being created and wishes to bring an end to those who created it.  Its hands radiate energy which can put pokemon to sleep with a single punch.  It appears on a full moon and gathers its energy from pokemon and people sleeping.

Request for @milkyway-hell. I hope you like it! I loved making this! I just love it.

summary: Repost: Hello my peaches, I’m gonna’ be honest. Nintendo dropped a bomb with that New Pokemon Switch Bundle with the Pokemon...
caption:
Repost:

Hello my peaches,

I’m gonna’ be honest. Nintendo dropped a bomb with that New Pokemon Switch Bundle with the Pokemon Variant switch. I would love to be able to have that bundle as my first switch and being able to play the lets go game!!

I’ll also do single pokemon if you don’t want a trainer!

title: Omastar - 139
body:
Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.

- Pokemon Ruby, Sapphire, Omega Ruby, Alpha Sapphire

summary: So, Oak in Pokémon Gen 1 (and FireRed/LeafGreen) stops the player from entering the tall grass...
title: So, Oak in Pokémon Gen 1 (and FireRed/LeafGreen) stops the player from entering the tall grass...
body: This clearly shows that going up against a wild Pokémon (regardless of what species/how harmless the Pokémon seems) without a Pokémon of your own is a very bad idea. Obviously this is true for all sorts of really strong Pokémon, but what about the weaker ones (like the one’s you generally encounter of the first route)?

reblog.comment: This clearly shows that going up against a wild Pokémon (regardless of what species/how harmless the Pokémon seems) without a Pokémon of your own is a very bad idea. Obviously this is true for all sorts of really strong Pokémon, but what about the weaker ones (like the one’s you generally encounter of the first route)?

summary: Professor Willow's Global Research Challenge Ends with a Power-Packed Ultra Bonus Event! The ultra bonus reward has finally been...
caption:
Professor Willow’s Global Research Challenge Ends with a Power-Packed Ultra Bonus Event!

The ultra bonus reward has finally been announced, and it’s a big one! First, the Legendary Birds will be back in raids for a week, from Sept. 13th to Sept. 20th, and yes, you can encounter their shiny forms! Along with them, Pokemon from the Kanto region will be more frequently seen worldwide until Sept. 30th.

After the 20th, the Legendary Pokemon that will be taking the birds’ and Regirock’s place will be none other than… Mewtwo! Mewtwo will at long last be available as a regular level 5 Legendary raid boss! And not just for a day, but more than a month! Mewtwo will leave raids on October 23rd, so there’s plenty of time to find some friends and battle this formerly exclusive raid boss!

Finally, region-locked Pokemon from Kanto - Mr. Mime, Kangaskhan, Tauros and Farfetch’d - will be joining their Alolan form friends in 7km eggs til the end of September! Don’t miss this chance to finish your Kanto Pokedex with these Pokemon!
